intro: Lupinus potosinus, commonly known as the Potosí lupin, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, erect growth habit and clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Lupinus potosinus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential use in ecological restoration projects.
